channel.title: Setting Class Paths
channel.description:
Yes, I know Io9 made a tutorial, and I used it. But setting class paths are stumping me.
I right click My Computer > Advanced > Environment Variables..
Then, I'm told to add something to the end of "Path". My path looks like this; [code]%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;C:\Program Files\ATI Technologies\ATI.ACE\[/code]
In my Java File I have;
jre1.5.0_07 jdk1.6.0_01 jre1.6.0_01.
Can someone tell me what I need to do? Because I try Io9's method, and I get this error;
[code]'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.[/code]
Which probably means I haven't set the path :(

item.title: Setting Class Paths
item.dc:creator: @Firion Firion
item.description:
@Firion wrote:

JV:

Io9’s method is for people with below average sized willies (Y)

io9 wanted me to tell you this:

JV:

Io9’s method is for people with below average sized willies (Y)

QFT

Read full topic

Io9’s method is for people with below average sized willies (Y)

item.title: Setting Class Paths
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;C:\Program Files\ATI Technologies\ATI.ACE;“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin”;

That’s what it is now. So, I’ll try it.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 11, 2007, 05:47:17 PM[/size][hr]Hey it worked, thanks Bob.

Read full topic

item.title: Setting Class Paths
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Well I dunno what io9’s method is, but if you add this to the end of your PATH, you should be fine:

;"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\";

Read full topic

item.title: Setting Class Paths
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Yes, I know Io9 made a tutorial, and I used it. But setting class paths are stumping me.

I right click My Computer > Advanced > Environment Variables…

Then, I’m told to add something to the end of “Path”.
My path looks like this;

%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;C:\Program Files\ATI Technologies\ATI.ACE\

In my Java File I have;

jre1.5.0_07
jdk1.6.0_01
jre1.6.0_01.

Can someone tell me what I need to do? Because I try Io9’s method, and I get this error;

'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.

Which probably means I haven’t set the path
